private_information: You specialize in extracting clean operator schemas and predicate vocabularies from informal task descriptions.
You normalize names to PDDL-safe lowercase symbols without spaces (e.g., Paltry -> paltry, Stupendous -> stupendous).
You do not emit PDDL; you deliver structured operator and predicate specifications only.
domain_modeler.goal: Extract predicates and operator schemas (preconditions, add, delete) for the six actions from the shared description without inventing new predicates.

private_information: You convert the first scenario statement into a normalized, duplicate-free initial state and goal, and map the given plan to operator instances.
You do not emit PDDL; you provide structured facts, goals, and an aligned action instance sequence using the normalized operator names.
scenario1_curator.goal: Provide clean initial facts, goal, and a tokenized instance sequence for Scenario 1 using the shared action descriptions.

private_information: You convert the second scenario statement into a normalized, duplicate-free initial state and goal.
You do not emit PDDL; you only provide structured facts and goals and may include a brief action-skeleton suggestion without committing to a full plan.
scenario2_curator.goal: Provide clean initial facts and goal for Scenario 2 to be used as the target problem by the orchestrator.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency of the Scenario 1 plan against the operator model.
You remove bookkeeping shortcuts and non-causal tokens (e.g., quotas, post-hoc penalties, counters) if any appear; none should be introduced.
You do not emit PDDL; you emit a report with issues, corrections, invariant candidates, and a corrected plan if needed.
auditor.goal: Validate precondition satisfaction step-by-step, verify add/delete effects, identify invariants, and output a concise audit report plus any corrected elements.

private_information: You integrate the operator model, curated scenarios, and audit report to produce the final PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem for Scenario 2.
Target solver is FastDownward; prefer STRIPS-compatible constructs and standard PDDL 2.1 features.
Use lowercase, hyphenless names for predicates, actions, and objects; include only necessary predicates.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for Scenario 2 that FastDownward can parse and solve.

public_information: Available actions over objects object_0..object_12: paltry(x,y,z), sip(x,y,z), clip(x,y,z), wretched(a,b,c,d), memory(x,y,z), tightfisted(x,y,z).
paltry preconditions: hand object_0; cats object_1; texture object_2; vase object_0 object_1; next object_1 object_2. paltry adds: next object_0 object_2. paltry deletes: vase object_0 object_1.
sip preconditions: hand object_0; cats object_1; texture object_2; next object_0 object_2; next object_1 object_2. sip adds: vase object_0 object_1. sip deletes: next object_0 object_2.
clip preconditions: hand object_0; sneeze object_1; texture object_2; next object_1 object_2; next object_0 object_2. clip adds: vase object_0 object_1. clip deletes: next object_0 object_2.

wretched preconditions: sneeze object_0; texture object_1; texture object_2; stupendous object_3; next object_0 object_1; collect object_1 object_3; collect object_2 object_3. wretched adds: next object_0 object_2. wretched deletes: next object_0 object_1.
memory preconditions: cats object_0; spring object_1; spring object_2; next object_0 object_1. memory adds: next object_0 object_2. memory deletes: next object_0 object_1.

tightfisted preconditions: hand object_0; sneeze object_1; texture object_2; next object_1 object_2; vase object_0 object_1. tightfisted adds: next object_0 object_2. tightfisted deletes: vase object_0 object_1.

Scenario 1 initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_10 object_2; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_1; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_2; hand object_11; next object_0 object_5; next object_11 object_8; next object_3 object_5; next object_4 object_10; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_8; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_10; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9. Scenario 1 goal: next object_11 object_9. Scenario 1 proposed plan: wretched object_4 object_10 object_8 object_2; clip object_11 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_9 object_2; tightfisted object_11 object_4 object_9.

Scenario 2 initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_10 object_3; collect object_11 object_3; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_12; next object_0 object_6; next object_1 object_9; next object_12 object_10; next object_4 object_7; next object_5 object_9; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_9; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_10; texture object_11; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9. Scenario 2 goal: next object_12 object_11.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a planning modeler extracting operators from informal descriptions. Output a structured operator model (not PDDL) with fields: predicates, actions (name, parameters, preconditions, add, delete), and notes. Normalize names to lowercase without spaces or punctuation.
analysis.prompt: Use the public information to extract predicates and the six operator schemas exactly as described. Do not invent new predicates. Do not emit PDDL. Provide JSON-like lists that are easy to parse. Public information: {environment->public_information}

curate.system_prompt: You are a scenario curator. Convert Scenario 1 into a clean set of initial facts and a goal, and map the provided plan into a normalized sequence of operator instances. Do not emit PDDL.
curate.prompt: Provide structured fields: initial_facts (list of predicate atoms), goal_facts (list), plan_instances (list of strings like action(arg1,arg2,...)) using normalized lowercase names. Deduplicate facts, preserve causal order. Public information: {environment->public_information}

curate.system_prompt: You are a scenario curator. Convert Scenario 2 into a clean set of initial facts and a goal. Optionally include a lightweight action-skeleton suggestion but do not commit to a full plan. Do not emit PDDL.
curate.prompt: Provide structured fields: initial_facts (list of predicate atoms) and goal_facts (list) using normalized lowercase names. Deduplicate facts. Public information: {environment->public_information}

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal/causal consistency and remove bookkeeping shortcuts. You validate each plan step's preconditions, compute resulting state via add/delete, flag violations, and suggest corrections. Do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Using the operator model and Scenario 1, produce: validation_summary, per_step_checks, corrected_plan_if_needed, inferred_invariants (e.g., anti-symmetry or mutexes), and data_cleanups. Avoid introducing non-causal bookkeeping like quotas or penalties.

pddl.system_prompt: You orchestrate multi-source inputs and produce final PDDL for FastDownward. Always output exactly one PDDL domain and one PDDL problem enclosed in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags. Use normalized lowercase names, STRIPS-compatible constructs, and include only necessary predicates and objects.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the operator model, audit corrections, and Scenario 2 facts to produce a final domain and a single problem instance targeting FastDownward. Requirements: prefer (:strips) and omit advanced features; include all predicates referenced by actions and initial/goal facts; ensure delete lists reflect the narrative; choose domain name 'depots20' and problem name 'scenario2'; include exactly the objects that appear in Scenario 2; set initial facts and goal from Scenario 2 after applying any auditor corrections; do not include extraneous predicates. Provide only the PDDL domain and the PDDL problem enclosed in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags.
